page_title_en: Horis New Mechanical Keypad Is Officially Licensed For PS5
page_description_en: Take your PlayStation gaming sessions to a new level with this PC-style keypad from Hori.
page_text_html:
If you've ever wanted to bring the flexibility of PC gaming to your console, then you might want to take a look at this controller from Hori. Officially licensed for the PS5 and PS4, the Hori Tactical Assault Commander is a mechanical keyboard that condenses the most useful inputs into a PC-style keypad. The keypad releases on December 6 and is available to preorder now at Amazon for $130.

Preorder at Amazon

Designed for FPS and MMORPG games where extra inputs can provide a substantial edge in gameplay, it's an updated version of Hori's Tactical Assault Commander Pro M2 that only works with games with native keyboard and mouse compatibility. This means the keypad could be useful for games such as Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II, Final Fantasy XIV, Fortnite, and The Elder Scrolls Online.

Out of the box, it features an ergonomic key layout with LED-backlit mechanical keys and an adjustable palm rest. You can also connect it to a companion app to customize its settings and save up to 6 profiles per platform, making it easy to switch between FPS and MMORPG setups on the fly.

For more hardware deals before Black Friday, you can save up to $200 on new M2-powered MacBooks, grab the Xbox Elite Series 2 controller for its lowest price yet, and this Xbox Series S deal cuts the price of the console while throwing a second controller in for free.
